transcripts.text: You're listening to Madison the Black Eagle on Sirius XM Urban View.

This entire show, all four hours, are going to be dedicated to my good friend, Congressman Elijah Cummings.  And I'll explain to you why.  He listened to this show, Sherry can come to the mic on this one and Darryl and Sam knows this.  I don't know how many of you all know this, but he listened to our show every morning in his commute from Washington and from Baltimore to Washington, D.C.

I just want to say that the soul of our democracy continues to be under threat, a historic threat.  And I grew up as a military brat.  And, you know, I feel this personally and Elijah felt it personally, that we need to make sure that we leave our democracy intact for our children.  And so I will continue to uphold that banner as well.

Your silence.  speaks volumes, Mr.  and Mrs.  Black Republicans.  You are in no position.  Look, if you cannot comment, if you cannot respond, if you cannot take action against this Clarence Mason Weaver and what he said publicly about black women, then I say to you with all honesty, you do not have the authority or the morality to say anything about blacks in the Democratic Party.
In Alabama, we've got 14 HBCUs in the state of Alabama.  It contributes so much to our economy.  We've got more than any state in the country.  Really?
So, wait a minute.  Alabama has more HBCUs than any state in the country?
Absolutely.  14.  Wow.  It's remarkable, remarkable, and they're just awesome.  They really do such a wonderful job in our state and produce so much for our economy.

God!  Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.  Do you want to play that again?  No, do you rule over us?  Wait, wait a minute.  God, oh man.  First of all, you're not a king.  Saul was a king.  David was a king.  You're not a king.  Most black people were Republicans.  because most Democrats during the Civil War and after the Civil War were outright racist Dixiecrats.  And Republicans were the ones who supported civil rights bills.  They were the ones who reported constitutional amendments to give newly freed slaves rights of citizenship.  They were the ones who supported issues that were of concern and interest to African Americans.  They supported education.  They supported historically black colleges.  And then you know what happened?  Around about 1950, along comes Strong Thurman and these Dixiecrats, and they got pissed because of the civil rights movement.  And that's when the switch started.  If you're one of these people that show up at these conferences and out there in the woods somewhere, or you've got a Nazi emblem, a swastika tattooed on your arm, you're a fucking loser.
Because the good old American flag won.  You're a loser.

Trump sees the world through Russia's worldview.  They have crafted that around him.  They have created a set of rose-colored glasses that they have lovingly polished and honed and put on his face.  at Miss Universe in 2014. that spells money.
The second time you've gone back to that Miss Universe piece.

Miss Universe is critical.  Why?  He had a secret two-hour meeting.  with the 12 richest men in Russia, multi, multi, multi billionaires, including Vladimir Putin's personal representative.  When he came out, he was promised, he said he's getting Moscow Tower.  And then from that day on, every statement he ever made about Barack Obama and Russia was Russian, almost straight Russian propaganda.

We have people who think that urban view should be undervalued, underestimated, and marginalized.  Yeah, they do.  Yeah, they do.  And they group all of us together like we're on some freaking slave ship.  And what do I mean?  Well, just throw them all in the group together.  It doesn't make any difference who they are, what they've done.  Let's, you know, just put them all together.  And that doesn't work.  You would no more do that to us than you would do that to Howard Stern than you would do that.  Can I call the roll?  Can I call the roll?  We are individuals with individual experiences, individual contributions, individual accomplishments.  And the biggest mistake you'll make is undervaluing, underestimating, and marginalizing us.
